text: Elizabeth Hartman (December 2, 1943 - June 10, 1987) was an American actress who mostly did movies. She starred in the movie A Patch of Blue with Shelley Winters and Sidney Poitier and received a Golden Globe Award for that role. Hartman was born in Youngstown, Ohio. Hartman had depression. On June 10, 1987, she jumped from the 5th floor of her apartment building in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania. The jump ended her life at age 43. == Other websites == * Category:American movie actors Category:Actors from Youngstown, Ohio Category:Suicides by jumping in the United States Category:1943 births Category:1987 deaths
title: Elizabeth Hartman
